snippet: The Mariners have intensified their pursuit of Robinson Cano, inviting him to Seattle for direct talks and reportedly preparing to offer him a deal worth roughly $25 million a year for nine years.
abstract: Seattle Mariners have intensified their pursuit of Robinson Cano, inviting him for direct talks and reportedly preparing to offer him a deal worth roughly $25 million a year for nine years; New York Yankees indicate they will not match the offer and will instead seek other players to replace Cano; Yankees introduce their newly signed catcher Brian McCann.
lead_paragraph: The Mariners have intensified their pursuit of Robinson Cano, inviting him to Seattle for direct talks and reportedly preparing to offer him a deal worth roughly $25 million a year for nine years.

headline.main: $225 Million? Seattle’s Pursuit of Cano Could Be Too Rich for Yanks
headline.print_headline: $225 Million? Seattle’s Pursuit of Cano Could Be Too Rich for Yanks
